metadata.subject: and....another bit of advice ...? on WA

relationships.description: New is seeking advice from Epstein regarding obtaining permission to use Woody Allen footage, and expresses gratitude for Epstein making the original taping possible
New taped an interview with Allen but cannot use the footage due to legal restrictions from Allen's legal team

analysis.purpose: To seek Jeffrey Epstein's advice on obtaining permission from Woody Allen's legal team to use interview footage for an online course and potential TV episode
analysis.significance: Shows Epstein's connections to academic and entertainment figures, and his role in facilitating access to high-profile individuals

concerns: Legal restrictions on using Woody Allen interview footage without permission

notable_quotes: Woody Allen's legal team said that we couldn't use the film we shot of him: online, for broadcast, anywhere.
It was a fantastic experience taping with him and so, even if I can't ever use the footage, I'm still grateful to you for making the day possible.
red_flags: Epstein's involvement in facilitating access to high-profile individuals for academic projects

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail or coercion found. The email shows a professional request for advice regarding legal permissions.

illegal_activity.description: No illegal activity discussed or evidenced. The email discusses legal restrictions on using interview footage properly.

public_knowledge.context: This appears to be a private email exchange regarding academic content production, not previously public information

analysis.summary: Elisa New (Harvard professor) emails Jeffrey Epstein seeking advice on obtaining permission from Woody Allen's legal team to use interview footage for her online literature course, expressing gratitude for Epstein's role in facilitating the original interview while listing other high-profile figures who have participated in her project.
